Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Controller
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The Controller class handles the action Listeners for all JButtons and controls what the View class displays on the GUI. It contains methods to play with one player or two players as well as methods to choose colors and display dialogs.
    Author:
    Meghan Rogers, Nick Chua, Ewan Akins
    See Also:
    "https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/colorchooser.html", Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(Model model)
        The constructor creates a View object to begin the game and displays the opening message. It also holds the action listeners for three JButtons.

      • pressButton

        public void pressButton(int i,
                        int j)
        pressButton is called from class View's action listener when a JButton on the game board is pressed. It utilizes Model to check for a valid move, insert the game symbol, and check for a winner.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the button that was pressed
        j - the column of the button that was pressed

      • checkWin

        public void checkWin(int i,
                     int j,
                     int turn)
        Checks the board for a winner.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the button that was pressed
        j - the column of the button that was pressed
        turn - an integer that keeps track of who's turn it is

        The main() method for the program. Creates a Model object and a Controller object.
